bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Walter M. Simpson, May 22, 1941

div1.p: Hench thanks Simpson for the photograph he sent. He informs him that he will speak during a preview unveiling of the Walter Reed Yellow Fever group painting, and invites Simpson to attend.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Walter M. Simpson, May 22, 1941
div1.p:
Thanks so much for the picture. How did you ever
get a hold of this? Fortunately for me, I have a copy, as
Dr. Agramonte's daughter gave me a copy last year in Cuba.
I am sorry to have made you go to all this trouble. I shall
keep the copy here in case you want it back. Mine is a small
copy of the original size which is about 3 x 4 inches.

Do you expect to be in Cleveland the first Monday
of the A.M.A.? The Wyeth people are having a preview un-
veiling of the Walter Reed Yellow Fever group painting. I
am to speak at the luncheon and if you are to be there and
would like to come, I will certainly wangle an invitation
for you and your wife. Walter Reed's daughter and other
notables are to be there.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
